intro: Plumeria cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban frangipani, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, including Cuba and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to yellow and pink. The plant has simple, opposite, and often hairy leaves, and its stems are smooth and slightly woody. It thrives in warm, tropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The flowers are typically borne on long, slender peduncles and bloom in the summer months.
